ticket.title: Fixture ID and String#hash in 1.9.1
ticket.original-body: An example from my terminal: ![Terminal output][http://img.skitch.com/20090304-qmeumn8xnwwpd2pheemtawuidr.jpg] It seems like the output of String#hash varies from process to process. This means that the ID that the foxy fixtures generates (which uses String#hash on the fixture key name) are only dependable per test run, not across multiple runs. I wish I could provide a patch or suggest a solution, but after some sparse investigating I haven't found anything about changes to String#hash in 1.9.1. This is only a problem when you refer to the IDs generated by the foxy fixtures, which you rarely do anyways. I discovered this in an app where I refer to some IDs in a config/settings.yml, and because I use fixture data via rake db:fixtures:load when developing, refering to these IDs are not reliable on 1.9 because they will change the next time I run rake db:fixtures:load.

This means that the ID that the foxy fixtures generates (which uses String#hash on the fixture key name) are only dependable per test run, not across multiple runs. I wish I could provide a patch or suggest a solution, but after some sparse investigating I haven't found anything about changes to String#hash in 1.9.1. This is only a problem when you refer to the IDs generated by the foxy fixtures, which you rarely do anyways. I discovered this in an app where I refer to some IDs in a config/settings.yml, and because I use fixture data via rake db:fixtures:load when developing, refering to these IDs are not reliable on 1.9 because they will change the next time I run rake db:fixtures:load.
ticket.original-body-html:
An example from my terminal:

![Terminal output][http://img.skitch.com/20090304-q...]

It seems like the output of String#hash varies from process to process. This means that the ID that the foxy fixtures generates (which uses String#hash on the fixture key name) are only dependable per test run, not across multiple runs.

I wish I could provide a patch or suggest a solution, but after some sparse investigating I haven't found anything about changes to String#hash in 1.9.1.

This is only a problem when you refer to the IDs generated by the foxy fixtures, which you rarely do anyways. I discovered this in an app where I refer to some IDs in a config/settings.yml, and because I use fixture data via rake db:fixtures:load when developing, refering to these IDs are not reliable on 1.9 because they will change the next time I run rake db:fixtures:load.

I wish I could provide a patch or suggest a solution, but after some sparse investigation I haven't found anything about changes to String#hash in 1.9.1.

This is only a problem when you refer to the IDs generated by the foxy fixtures, which you rarely do anyways. I discovered this in an app where I refer to some IDs in a config/settings.yml, and because I use fixture data via rake db:fixtures:load when developing, refering to these IDs are not reliable on 1.9 because they will change the next time I run rake db:fixtures:load.
version.title: Fixture ID and String#hash in 1.9.1

version.body:
Take a look at this pastie:
http://pastie.org/407108
As you can see, the implementation of String#hash has changed significantly since 1.8, and is indeed different in every process, because of the random number seeding that occurs in rb_memhash.
